data.title: Biography of Peter III King Aragon 1240
data.meta_description: Biography of Peter III King Aragon 1240-1285 including his birth, marriages, death and life events, life events of his siblings, and his ancestry to five generations, royal ancestors and royal descendants.
data.text:
On 12 Sep 1213 [his grandfather] Peter II King Aragon 1178-1213 (age 35) died. His son [his father] James I King Aragon (age 5) succeeded I King Aragon.

In 1240 Peter III King Aragon was born to James I King Aragon (age 31) and Violant Árpád Queen Consort Aragon (age 25).

Around 1251 [his mother] Violant Árpád Queen Consort Aragon (age 36) died.

On 04 Nov 1265 [his son] Alfonso III King Aragon 1265-1291 was born to Peter III King Aragon (age 25) and Constance Hohenstaufen Queen Consort Aragon (age 16).

On 10 Aug 1267 [his son] James "The Just" II King Aragon was born to Peter III King Aragon (age 27) and Constance Hohenstaufen Queen Consort Aragon (age 18).

In 1271 [his daughter] Elisabeth Barcelona Queen Consort Portugal 1271-1336 was born to Peter III King Aragon (age 31) and Constance Hohenstaufen Queen Consort Aragon (age 22).

On 13 Dec 1272 [his son] Frederick III King Sicily was born to Peter III King Aragon (age 32).

On 27 Jul 1276 [his father] James I King Aragon (age 68) died. His son Peter III King Aragon (age 36) succeeded III King Aragon.

In 1282 [his son-in-law] Denis I King Portugal 1261-1325 (age 20) and [his daughter] Elisabeth Barcelona Queen Consort Portugal 1271-1336 (age 11) were married. They were half third cousin once removed. He a great x 2 grandson of King Henry "Curtmantle" II of England 1133-1189. She by marriage Queen Consort Portugal. She the daughter of Peter III King Aragon 1240-1285 (age 42) and Constance Hohenstaufen Queen Consort Aragon (age 33). He the son of Alfonso III King Portugal and Beatrice Queen Consort Portugal (age 40).

In Feb 1282 John Vesci was sent with Bishop Antony Bek (age 37) to negotiate a marriage between [his son] Alfonso (age 16), son of King Peter III of Aragon (age 42), and King Edward's (age 42) daughter Eleanor (age 12), which resulted in the signing of the contract as proxy at Huesca.

On 11 Nov 1285 Peter III King Aragon (age 45) died. His son [his son] Alfonso III King Aragon 1265-1291 (age 20) succeeded III King Aragon.

[his son] Frederick III King Sicily and Eleanor Capet were married. They were half second cousin once removed. She a great x 3 granddaughter of King Henry "Curtmantle" II of England 1133-1189. She the daughter of Charles II King Naples 1254-1309 and Mary of Hungary Queen Consort Naples. He the son of Peter III King Aragon 1240-1285.

[his father] James I King Aragon and Eleanor Ivrea Queen Consort Aragon were married. They were half second cousins. She a granddaughter of King Henry "Curtmantle" II of England 1133-1189. She by marriage Queen Consort Aragon. She the daughter of Alfonso VIII King Castile 1155-1214 and Eleanor Plantagenet Queen Consort Castile. He the son of Peter II King Aragon 1178-1213 and Marie Montpellier Queen Consort Aragon.

Peter III King Aragon and Constance Hohenstaufen Queen Consort Aragon were married. She a great x 5 granddaughter of King William "Conqueror" I of England 1028-1087. She by marriage Queen Consort Aragon. He the son of James I King Aragon and Violant Árpád Queen Consort Aragon.

[his father] James I King Aragon and [his mother] Violant Árpád Queen Consort Aragon were married. She by marriage Queen Consort Aragon. He the son of Peter II King Aragon 1178-1213 and Marie Montpellier Queen Consort Aragon.

[his father] James I King Aragon and Teresa Gil Vidaure Queen Consort Aragon were married. She by marriage Queen Consort Aragon. He the son of Peter II King Aragon 1178-1213 and Marie Montpellier Queen Consort Aragon.
